summary:
After an MA in Product Design at the Politecnico School of Design in Milan (2011) Francesco moved to The Netherlands to work for the Italian designers duo Formafantasma. 
After working there as Senior Designer & Senior Design Assistant (2012-2016), his interest in product design evolved towards a broader research-based practice, blurring the boundaries between design and visual arts.

_

In 2015 he is founder of No-Rocket Studio, creative inter-disciplinary practice.
Expanding his love for tactility and process, producing a fresh, eclectic yet coherent body of work distinguished by a strong ’hands-on’ imprint. 
No-Rocket finds inspiration on the borders between disciplines, transferring knowledge and methods between different fields, using design, installations, paintings and illustrations as tools for communicating ideas, visualising complexity in a ‘human’ way, giving tactility to the intangible and are often developed by juxtaposing contrasts: digital and analog, valuable and scraps, solemn and playful, personal and public.

no-rocket.com

_

Since 2017 Francesco works actively as artist placed at the convergence between formal and conceptual, exploring human condition and everyday life events in the context of contemporary society, following a research where perception, intuition and memory play an essential role. 
He explores new connections between the art world and his personal fascinations with scientific knowledge, combined together in open systems with which the audience can relate for investigating both their inner worlds and their surroundings. 
The body of work in his current artistic research focuses on the limits of human perception and the blurry boundaries of our sensorial experience, the ‘image of the self’ and ‘the image of reality’. 
His formal research is characterized by an abundance of materials and techniques, informed by his background in applied arts and further conceptualized within art. 
In a constant balance between control and spontaneity, order and turmoil, tending to free-floating forms, he integrates new modalities of visual composition, gestural expressionism and meticulous formal re-configurations.
It is a process in which one action leads to the next in an ongoing echo that has much to do with reacting rather than acting.
FZ’s work goes beyond the single format of the art medium, ranging from large-scale paintings, drawings, object-like sculptures and installations, often in conversation with each other and creating multiple configurations and parallel narratives.

fzorzi.com

projects.title: Perestrello 4.0 / Public Art Intervention - Painting
projects.description:
The project intervention developed by No-Rocket Studio is a 200mq wall painting as project part of the Biennial of Public Space 2019, in which public art experiences and projects of co-creation in Italy and the Netherlands are placed side by side.

This project is a commission of the Embassy & General Consulate of The Kingdom of The Netherlands in Italy as a collaboration between Italian and Dutch professionals, developed in collaboration with Orizzontale Architects (Rome, IT), working on strengthening local identity, common goods & urban revival in fragile areas.

Public Art Intervention - Painting:
Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio

Public Art Intervention - Installation:
Orizzontale

Project by:
Embassy & General Consulate of The Kingdom of The Netherlands in Italy

projects.title: Asinello Press / Logo Illustration
projects.description:
Asinello Press is an open publishing platform initiated by SpaceCaviar (Genoa, IT). 
It relies on manual processes and obsolete technologies to produce experimental, low budget, short print-run publications with artists & architects around the world.

Since the first issue (Thomás Saraceno, Cosmic Jive: The Spider Sessions), Asinello Press is using the logo I designed as Ex-Libris illustration.
A bigger version of the Asinello Press illustration is risograph printed on the ex libris that comes together with the publication.

Logo Illustration: 
Francesco Zorzi

Project by: 
SpaceCaviar, Bakuh, Opusmetrico (Valter Scelsi)

Art Direction & Identity: 
Giovanni Pezzato

projects.title: Marmofurniture / Artworks collages
projects.description:
Abstract and tactile collages for Marmofurniture product design company based in Shanghai.
The materials, the values and the distinctive personality of the brand has been translated in this collection of artworks for the Marmo Catalogue 2020.

Illustrations:
Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio

Creative direction:
Lodovico Bernardi

Graphic design:
Leonardo Pertile

projects.title: MACULA / The Theater is in the Mind - Short film production
projects.description:
This short film production is as a continuation of the research project developed in at the AAR American Academy in Rome (September-December 2018) the complex interconnection between eyes and brain, vision and altered perception due to brain compensation, AMD Macular Degeneration and CBS Visual Hallucinations.
It has been supported by the Embassy and Consulate General of the Kingdom of The Netherlands in Italy and it focuses on the perception of reality seen from the inside of the mind of people affected by AMD and CBS, and it’s based on an archive of those 7 years of voice recordings of experiences of hallucinations from my mother

The film MACULA / The Theater is in the Mind has been premiered at the Lago Film Festival 2019 - International Festival of Independent Cinema (Treviso, IT).
It's currently in competition for International screenings.

Project by:
Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio

Filming & photography:
Gabriele Mariotti 

Music:
Nick Malkin

Supported by:
Embassy and Consulate General of the Kingdom of The Netherlands in Italy

projects.title: Alles Transacties - Everything Transaction / Illustrations & Visual Design
projects.description:
Lava Amsterdam contacted me to develop a visual system do visually introduce the concepts of the book Alles transactie / Everything Transaction. The project, initiated by Innopay, aims to help leaders of today to navigate better in the world of financial technology. 
Alles transactie is about data, trust and the unprecedented opportunities of the transactional internet. The book describes the relation between transactions, the buying process, platforms, data and trust. 
The handmade illustrations and the visual system developed help the reader to navigate the complex content about major technological developments, make this specialist content accessible to the public.

Alles transactie / Everything is Transaction is a book created by experienced fintech pioneers Chiel Liezenberg, Douwe Lycklama and Shikko Nijland of Innopay, also known from succesfull digital products like iDeal and OV-Chipkaart.
Design by Lava Amsterdam and Illustration by Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio.
 
The book was the #1 selling marketing book in The Netherlands for 17 days. 

Illustrations & Visual System: 
Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio

Graphic design:
Lava Amsterdam

Project by:
Innopay

projects.title: MindfulNS - What if Lab x NS Nederlandse Spoorwegen / Visual Design & Experience Installation
projects.description:
I've been commissioned by Jan Pieter Kaptein, winner of the Way if Lab 2017 x NS Nederlandse Spoorwegen the visual design and installation for the experience wagon of his project MindfulNS.
MindfulNS allows you to practice mindfulness on the train, through a custom-designed that allows travellers to get acquainted with meditation in an accessible manner, while traveling on NS trains during the Dutch Design Week 2017. 
The interiors of the MindfulNS wagon are covered in mirroring symbols made out of reflective mirror film on glass windows, designed as a visual translations of some of the most common elements in mindfulness practice.
While people practicing mindfulness train to carve some space between themselves and the world running fast around them, this installation challenges their focus to rediscover themselves in the mirror symbols surrounding them.
These mirroring symbols interact actively both with the inside/outside of the wagon: they reflect the sunlight coming in from the windows and they cast shadows according to the ever-changing weather.

Visual Design & Experience Installation:
Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio

Project by:
Jan Pieter Kaptein

projects.title: The Thermal Paper Project
projects.description:
The Thermal Paper Project is the name of a 5 years long research on thermal paper (the same material any receipt and bill you have ever touched has been made of) as a material for visual expression. 
Its the combination of three 'chapters' of research and experimentation and each one of them culminated in an exhibition, : The Invisible Line (Dutch Design Week 2012 - Eindhoven, NL), Contemporary Archeology (Dutch Design Week 2015 - Eindhoven, NL), Goodbye Receipts/Hello Receipts (Milan Design Week 2017 - Milan, IT). 

Through the years thermal paper has been investigated from many angles: from a material developed for machines to a support for human intervention; from by-product commodity to a precious craft material.
To produce this collection of artworks no ink has ever been used; no paint, no watercolour and nothing has been printed. Each splash of color, gradient, cross-hatching is the result of advanced experimentation using heat, chemical agents and friction to reveal the color dyes embedded inside the paper itself.

projects.title: Fungal Futures 01 / Visual Design & Identity
projects.description:
I was commissioned by Officina Corpuscoli, curator and producer of Fungal Futures 01, to develop the visual identity of the exhibition. Fungal Futures 01 is an investigation of Upcoming Future.
"Shaped by novel materials and processes relying on the fundamental role of fungal micro- organisms.
A new way of conceiving a "Living" Museum, filled with projects envisioning novel advancements and potentially near futures, while re-imagining the way in which our domestic and social life will morph during the next decades."
The entire visual system acts as a reflection on the content of the exhibition, visually conveying the research that lying behind it and the very nature of mycelium and fungal microorganisms.

Visual Design & Identity: 
Francesco Zorzi / No-Rocket Studio

Project by:
Maurizio Montalti / Officina Corpuscoli

profile_positions.description:
Francesco Zorzi (IT, 1985) is an artist placed at the convergence between formal and conceptual, exploring human condition and everyday life events in the context of contemporary society, following a research where perception, intuition and memory play an essential role. 
FZ explores new connections between the art world and his personal fascinations with scientific knowledge, combined together in open systems with which the audience can relate for investigating both their inner worlds and their surroundings. 
The body of work in his current artistic research focuses on the limits of human perception and the blurry boundaries of our sensorial experience, the ‘image of the self’ and ‘the image of reality’. 
His formal research is characterized by an abundance of materials and techniques, informed by his background in applied arts and further conceptualized within art. 
In a constant balance between control and spontaneity, order and turmoil, tending to free-floating forms, he integrates new modalities of visual composition, gestural expressionism and meticulous formal re-configurations.
It is a process in which one action leads to the next in an ongoing echo that has much to do with reacting rather than acting.
FZ’s work goes beyond the single format of the art medium, ranging from large-scale paintings, drawings, object-like sculptures and installations, often in conversation with each other and creating multiple configurations and parallel narratives.
profile_positions.title: Visual Artist

profile_positions.description:
No-Rocket is a creative atelier producing fresh and tactile visual work distinguished by a strong ’hands-on’ imprint. No-Rocket offers an inter-disciplinary approach to commissions, producing a fresh, eclectic yet coherent body of work distinguished by a strong ’hands-on’ imprint. 
No-Rocket finds inspiration on the borders between disciplines, transferring knowledge and methods between different fields, using design, installations, paintings and illustrations as tools for communicating ideas, visualising complexity in a ‘human’ way, giving tactility to the intangible and are often developed by juxtaposing contrasts: digital and analog, valuable and scraps, solemn and playful, personal and public.
No-Rocket offers services ranging from graphic design to visual identities, wall painting, visual design and illustration, illustrated infographics, hand-drawn icon design, hand-drawn typography, project development from concept to execution.
profile_positions.title: Creative

profile_positions.description: Teaching Visual Design at the Design Bachelor of MADE Program, Academy of Fine Arts in Siracusa, Sicily (IT).
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Francesco has been hired by Visionar Agency (Milan, IT) to realise a series of illustrations for the clothing brand Canadian
profile_positions.title: Illustrator

profile_positions.description: Francesco was hired by Lodovico Bernardi, Creative Director of Marmoforniture, a product design Company based in Shanghai, to create bespoke illustrations for their new product catalogue. Starting from their photoshooting images of textures and materials, Francesco converted the quality of their products into abstract digital collages, in which aesthetics and materials are in constant balance, creating dynamic and tactile complex visual sensations.
profile_positions.title: Visual Artist

profile_positions.description:
In 2018  Francesco receives a grant from the Embassy & Consulate General of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Italy (NL) for the production of a short film, a new chapter on his ongoing research Macula - The Theater is in The Mind. 
The film Macula - The Theater is in The Mind has been exhibited as world premiere at LFF Lago Film Fest, Revine Lago IT, and it's been nominated for the awards Best Veneto Director and Best Original Soundtrack.

Video developed in collaboration with:
Gabriele Mariotti, NL, ES (photography and editing)
Nick Malkin, USA (original soundtrack)
profile_positions.title: Visual Artist

company.name: Embassy and Consulate General of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Italy

profile_positions.company: Embassy and Consulate General of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Italy
profile_positions.description:
The Embassy and Consulate General of the Kingdom of The Netherlands in Italy paired Amsterdam based visual artist Francesco Zorzi with the team of italian architects Orizzontale, to develop a site specific public art installation that could socially engage with the local community of the district and the history of the location.
The project was a live painting performance part of the project Argonauti - Perestrello 4.0 in Rome, on July 2019. The artwork is a 287 square meters floor painting on the square of Largo Perestrello, Rome (IT). 
Lagoon puts in dialogue the pre-existing installation present in the square (Iceberg, Perestrello 3.0, by Orizzontale) and the very history of the site, which used to be a ditch (Acqua Bullicante) then buried during the urbanization in the ‘30s.
The painting shows the melting of the iceberg, and its fragments are recombined to shape a calm painted bay, where the boat of the Argonauts can dock and liven up the community living in the area.
The painting becomes the platform to host the wooden installation Argonauti from Orizzontale architects built on the site in a second phase.
profile_positions.title: Visual Artist

profile_positions.description:
In 2019 Francesco has been collaborating with Lava Amsterdam + Innopay with the realisation of the graphic content for their book Alles Transatie, nominated Management book of the year 2019. 
For this publication Francesco translated complex management-and-finance-based knowledge into simple visuals and infographics to better understanding the content of the book. 
He also developed an open system of icons and hand-drawn typography to implement the visual communication of the book and its printed content.
profile_positions.title: Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description:
Francesco created the large indoor wall painting for the restaurant nNea in Amsterdam. 
nNea, awarded n.8 50 best pizza restaurant in Europe, decided to visually communicate its spirit and values through a bold visual intervention that would connect the historical roots and traditions with a fresh contemporary flavour and attitude, full of color and dynamism.
profile_positions.title: Visual Artist

profile_positions.description:
Tiffany & Co. Italian Fellow in Design at AAR American Academy in Rome.
MACULA / The Theater is in the Mind is the project I initiated at AAR, a research through
design and visual arts about the complex interconnection between eyes and brain, vision and altered perception due to brain compensation, AMD Macular Degeneration and CBS Visual Hallucinations.
It evolved into a broad, eclectic assemblage of different interventions, with an inter-disciplinary approach, and it’s still a work-in-progress.

There the project took the shape of an exhibition, and a collection of objects, drawings, sculptures and mirrors.
Objects have a meaning by themselves, but they also dialogue with each other, and with the space to communicate a feeling of forced isolation, of unknown oddities.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellowship
